info.title: Digital Bank API
info.description: Open Connect is a modern, integrated and a highly scalable payment switch platform with an efficient service-oriented architecture approach. The platform is completely independent and has a multiplayer design. The core technology for messaging is based on Queue manager, which is a highly scalable MQ system, which can be horizontally scaled to run on a cluster of machines. The deployment can be done on Virtual environment as well as containerized environment. # API Code Reference This section contains lists of purpose codes and response codes utilized or generated by APIs ## Purpose Codes This data element is used to carry payment details in IBFT and RAAST Transfer transaction. The payment may be between business to business (B2B), business to consumer (B2C), consumer to business (C2B), business to government (B2G), and government to consumer (G2C) etc. | Code | Particulars | |-------|--------------------------------------------| | 0101 | Vendor Payments - Software | | 0102 | Vendor Payments - Hardware | | 0103 | Vendor Payments – Spare parts | | 0104 | Vendor Payments - Services | | 0105 | Vendor Payments – Advance Payment | | 0106 | Vendor Payments - Refunds | | 0107 | Distributor Payments - Goods | | 0108 | Distributor Payment – Expired Items | | 0109 | Distributor PMT – DISC on Early Payment | | 0110 | Exchange Items/Returns | | 0111 | Distributor Refunds | | 0112 | Merchant Payments - These custom codes are used in addition to or sometimes in place of standard HTTP status codes to provide more detailed and context-specific information about the integration process. | Code starts with | Description | |------------------|-----------------------------------------------------| | 01 | 1LINK assigned code for IBFT Title fetch and advise | | 02 | 1LINK assigned code for bill payments | | 03 | RAAST assigned code for RAAST ID operations and RAAST P2P payments | | 04 | Open Connect response code comes usually where any validation failed at middleware level | | 4xx | Default HTTP error code (4xx series) | | 5xx | Default HTTP error code (5xx series) | | Response Code | Response Description | |--------------|------------------------------------------------------------------| | 0000 | PROCESSED OK / IBFT advice sent to beneficiary bank. It is used for IBFT status inquiry product | | 0101 | ACCOUNT LIMIT EXCEEDED | | 0102 | INVALID ACCOUNT/ PAYER ACCOUNT IS INVALID/WALLET NUMBER | | 0103 | ACCOUNT INACTIVE | | 0104 | LOW/INSUFFICIENT Unable to process/ No response received by SBP | | HTTP Response Code | Description | |--------------------|---------------------------| | 400 | Bad Request | | 401 | Unauthorized | | 403 | Forbidden tags.name: Token API SPECS
tags.description: The client needs to authenticate itself before interacting with any Openconnect APIs

tags.name: OpenConnect API Specs
tags.description: These are the API(s) which will be exposed by OpenConnect

tags.name: Client Bank API Specs
tags.description: These are the API(s) which will be exposed by Bank

post.description:
This method is secure and includes enhancements that allow for more robust security mechanisms, which will ensure that the Open Connect integration is secure and reliable.


This is also the centralized authentication mechanism for all the APIs exposed by Open Connect. This will be running as a separate application on specific port.

access_token.description: This token will be used in all APIs in header with header name “Authorization”. Token value will be followed by Bearer

post.description: The unified title fetch is a generic method to get beneficiary (receiver) account details from the member bank.The method is having a following two additional functionalities compare to standard title fetch method: - Preferred Rail: The initiator has provision to set the preferred rail either the title fetch will be done via RAAST or 1LINK. The request parameter will identify the preferred route - Fall-back option: In case if title fetch failed with the preferred rail the system will auto attempt the title fetch from alternate rail. The option is controllable via request parameters.

response_desc.description: Description for the respective response code

correlationId.description: Unique correlation id for the title fetch request. The value is in GUID format and will be sent by the initiator in payment call.

destinationPaymentSystem.description:
Identify the route from which title fetch has completed. 

The values are as:


"01" – For RAAST


"02" – For 1LINK

iban.description: Beneficiary IBAN, the value will be returned if received from the scheme in response of title fetch

bankIMD.description: Receiving participant IMD (Member bank id), assigned by 1LINK

bankBIC.description: Receiving participant BIC (bank institution code), assigned by SBP

post.description:
The request will be used to fetch beneficiary account details via RAAST ID. 


A "RAAST ID" is a unique identifier assigned to an individual for the purpose of collecting funds. This ID is registered through the individual's bank, which is then integrated into the State Bank of Pakistan's Central Addressing Scheme (CAS). This integration allows individuals to receive funds without the need to divulge their complete bank account details, including account number, bank and branch information.


When a payee has to receive funds, they only need to provide their RAAST ID. The CAS system manages the beneficiary's account details and associated information. This information is shared when a payer initiates a fund transfer via a bank's digital channel, using the payee's RAAST ID. This streamlined process enhances the efficiency and security of interbank fund transfers by simplifying the recipient's identification and fund collection.

response_desc.description: Description for the respective response code

correlationId.description: Unique correlation id for the title fetch request. The value is in GUID format and will be sent by the initiator in payment call.

name.description: Beneficiary nick name registered in central addressing scheme

type.description: Receiver account type. The value will be like “DFLT”

memberId.description: Receiving participant BIC (bank institution code), assigned by SBP

get.description: Request to get institution list

participants.accountNumberHelp: Please provide 14 digits NBP account # or IBAN
Please provide 11 digits mobile # or IBAN for beneficiary

response_desc.description: Description for the respective response code

bankId.description: Bank id assigned by open connect

accountNumberHelp.description: Help Text which can be used to show format to customer on screen in user readable form.

accountNumberREGEX.description: Account # format, the field will be displayed to user where user input beneficiary account #

isAvailable1LINKIBFT.description: Indicate bank support IBFT payments followed by “Y” or “N”

isAvailableRAASTP2P.description: Indicate bank support P2P payments followed by “Y” or “N”

isAvailableRAASTBulk.description: Indicate bank support RAAST bulk receiving payments followed by “Y” or “N”

isAvailableRAASTP2M.description: Indicate bank support P2M payments followed by “Y” or “N”

isAvailableRAASTP2MRTP.description: Indicate bank support P2M “request to pay” payments followed by “Y” or “N”

isAvailableRAASTP2MPISP.description: Indicate bank support RAAST PISP features followed by “Y” or “N”

post.description: To send funds to member bank account using 1LINK

response_desc.description: Description for the respective response code

correlationId.description: Unique correlation id for the title fetch request. The value is in GUID format and will be sent by the initiator in payment call.

post.description:
This service will be used to send P2P payment via Raast for interbank transfer. The service will be sent credit request directly to RAAST without sending any debit request to bank middleware/CBS. This service ideally needs to be used in scenario where bank’s system can debit customer account itself and sent only credit request to Raast via open connect. 


Open connect return additional fields upon successful response, bank’s middleware needs to sent same values to CBS while debit confirmation or release. These key parameters will be used for RECON purpose.

response_desc.description: Description for the respective response code

correlationId.description: Unique correlation id for the title fetch request. The value is in GUID format and will be sent by the initiator in payment call.

endToEndId.description: End to end id sent to RAAST

post.description:
The service will be exposed by the bank. The purpose of the method is to allow member banks and schemes such as RAAST or 1LINK to get customer account info which is known as Title fetch request.


The title fetch usually comes before payment request where sender wants to verify beneficiary account title and account validation to make sure payment will be sent into the beneficiary account.

response.responseDesc: Invalid account or no account found

responseDesc.description: Description for the respective response code

idType.description:
Receiver account id type available in bank’s profile. Bank may return list of id type and values in case of joint account and if bank’s have multiple identity values for a customer. 


The id types are as:


•	CNIC

•	NIC

•	NICOP

•	POC

•	NTN

•	PASSPORT

•	REGNUM (Registration Number

idValue.description: Identity value of respective identity type

post.description:
The method is used to credit bank’s customer account whenever payment comes from RAAST. The Open connect sent credit request to the bank’s system using this method in the request mode. In case of rejection Open connect will instantly return payment to sender bank.


Description	Request to credit bank’s customer account, the request can be initiated by 1LINK and RAAST for following transactions:


•	IBFT inward payment

•	RAAST P2P inward payment

•	RAAST P2P outward return payment

response.responseDesc: Credit limit exceed for the account

responseDesc.description: Description for the respective response code

post.description:
Advise means where bank is responsible to credit amount into the receiver account. As a guaranteed delivery mechanism (SAF), OC will be sent credit request as advise to bank’s system via SAF mechanism.


This method will be used in any of below case:


•	1LINK incoming credit advise

•	RAAST P2P Inward return payments, this happens when previously made outward P2P payment failed at receiving bank end and bank initiate return after sometime.

•	RAAST P2P Timeout transactions

x-codeSamples.source:
curl -X POST \
--url 'https://apigw.paysyslabs.com/api/v1/bank/payments/creditadvise' \
--header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
--header 'Authorization: Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzUxMiJ9.eyJzdWIiOiJ0ZWxlbm9yfGliIiwiZXhwIjoxNjc3OTMyNDYyLCJpYXQiOjE2Nzc4NDYwNjJ9.ayCCTTt1YGD9Kc_p0XM3X5meYrCYB5-M2LblBG8iQ3TiEEfsNc7imeRkxJwkXoxGZAxBsTeyd50dX3wdhB7big'            
--data '{

responseDesc.description: Description for the respective response code

post.description:
The purpose of this request to inquire the status of the previously posted credit request or advise.


In case if original transaction got timeout, the Open Connect initiate transaction inquiry to the check the transaction faith.

responseDesc.description: Description for the respective response code

orgresponseCode.description: Response code for the original request

orgresponseDesc.description: Description for the respective original response code

jwtToken.description:
JWT Token required in all APIs except /authentication enpoint which needs oaut2.1

For more information regarding JWT, check out [JWT](https://auth0.com/learn/json-web-tokens).

clientCredentials.description: For more information regarding oauth, check out [OAUTH](https://auth0.com/intro-to-iam/what-is-oauth-2).

client_id.description: client_id will be provided by PSL TEAM based on channel

client_secret.description: client_secret will be provided by PSL TEAM based on channel

p_UnifiedTitleFetch.description: Representation of a Unified Title Fetch

bankId.description:
Bank Id returned by the OC in get bank list service response.
For more information, see [Endpoint banklist](#bank-list).

priorityFlag.description:
The field determine the priority rail to perform title fetch.

| Value | Description   |
|-------|---------------|
| 01    | For RAAST     |
| 02    | For 1LINK     |

fallbackFlag.description:
The field determine the fall back feature for the title fetch in case title fetch failed from 
the 1st switch system will attempt to perform it from alternate route if fall back parameter 
set to “Yes”.

| Value | Description   |
|-------|---------------|
| 01    | YES     |
| 02    | NO     |

purposeCode.description: the acceptable length of this field will depends on the value provided, please refer to [Purpose Code Table](#purp-code)

amount.description: Amount of the transaction, it is required as per EFT compliant that receiver must validate credit limit on title fetch to minimize rejection ratio while payment

p_GetDefaultAccount.description: Representation of a Get Default Account

bankIMD.description: Bank IMD, received in response of title fetch

toAccountTitle.description: Beneficiary account title, received in response of title fetch

purposeCode.description: 4 digits numeric 1LINK assigned payment purpose code. please refer to [Purpose Code Table](#purp-code)

narration.description: Any alpha numeric text upto 140 characters

amount.description: Amount of the transaction, bank make sure that the amount will be same which bank sent during title fetch

authId.description: Debit authorization unique reference number return by core banking in response of debit hold request

tfcorrelationId.description: Unique correlation id for the title fetch request. The value will be same which channel received in response of title fetch

bankBIC.description: Bank BIC, received in response of title fetch

toAccountTitle.description: Beneficiary account title, received in response of title fetch

purposeCode.description: 4 digits numeric 1LINK assigned payment purpose code. please refer to [Purpose Code Table](#purp-code)

narration.description: Any alpha numeric text upto 140 characters

amount.description: Amount of the transaction, bank make sure that the amount will be same which bank sent during title fetch

authId.description: Debit authorization unique reference number return by core banking in response of debit hold request

msgId.description: Unique reference number to sent RAAST. The key will be communicated end to end and will be used for e2e reconciliation. Bank is responsible to make sure that the id will not be duplicated in any case

b_TitleFetch.description: Representation of a Bank's Controller Title Fetch

initiator.description: Fixed value from any of them

amount.description: Amount of the transaction, it can be zero.

b_CreditPosting.description: Representation of a Bank's Controller Credit Posting

senderBankIMD.description: The value comes if transaction received from 1LINK. In other case it will be blank

senderBankBIC.description: The value comes if transaction received from RAAST. In other case it will be blank

fromAccountCnic.description: Sender CNIC if value received in the payment request

purposeCode.description:
3 digits numeric RAAST assigned payment purpose code. If payment received from 1LINK the value will be of 4 digits.
please refer to [Purpose Code Table](#purp-code)

narration.description: Any alpha numeric text upto 140 characters

instrId.description:
Instruction id received by RAAST.


In case of 1LINK the field will be blank

endToEndId.description:
End to end id received by RAAST.


In case of 1LINK the field will be blank.

txId.description:
Transaction id received by RAAST.


In case of 1LINK the field will be blank.

msgId.description:
Message id received by RAAST.

In case of 1LINK the field will be blank.

b_CreditAdvise.description: Representation of a Bank's Controller Credit Advise

initiator.description: Transaction received by, any of followings

senderBankIMD.description: The value comes if transaction received from 1LINK. In other case it will be blank

senderBankBIC.description: The value comes if transaction received from RAAST. In other case it will be blank

fromAccountCnic.description: Sender CNIC if value received in the payment request

purposeCode.description:
3 digits numeric RAAST assigned payment purpose code. If payment received from 1LINK the value will be of 4 digits.
please refer to [Purpose Code Table](#purp-code)

narration.description: Any alpha numeric text upto 140 characters

instrId.description:
Instruction id received by RAAST.


In case of 1LINK the field will be blank

endToEndId.description:
End to end id received by RAAST.


In case of 1LINK the field will be blank.

txId.description:
Transaction id received by RAAST.


In case of 1LINK the field will be blank.

msgId.description:
Message id received by RAAST.

In case of 1LINK the field will be blank.

oneLinkrrn.description:
Retrieval reference number.

In case of 1LINK, OC will send same value which comes from 1LINK in DE-37. 

In case of RAAST the field will be blank

oneLinkstan.description:
System trace audit number.

In case of 1LINK, OC will send same value which comes from 1LINK in DE-11.

In case of RAAST the field will be blank.

orgendToEndId.description: Original transaction end to end id

b_CreditInquiry.description: Representation of a Bank's Controller Credit Inquiry
